title: Ticket #504: The "scripts as executables" code incorrectly handles binary names
description: The "scripts as executables" code incorrectly handles binary executable names. Meaning names of the form executable.$$(OPSYS), for instance, will not be treated as executables, if $$(OPSYS) does not happen to be a known file extension. Previous to script detection, any executable name, aside from .bat and .cmd, were treated as Windows binaries.
check_ins:
2009-Jun-12 10:10   Check-in [14890]: Ticket #504: 16-bit applications with no extension we being runs as regular executable. We now check to make sure that the application has not already been classified as a 16-bit executable. (By Ben Burnett )
2009-May-21 15:34   Check-in [14749]: Ticket #504: Windows binaries with non-standard extensions will now be run as they were in the past. That is, Condor will try to run them as if they were real executables files. This behavior was broken by a previous commit. (By Ben Burnett )
creator: burnett
